unit_learning_outcomes.description: demonstrate a well- developed knowledge of the principles, concepts and techniques of a broad range of areas in analysis and applied mathematics, with significant depth in analysis and functional analysis.
interpret mathematical information communicated in wide range of forms.
apply mathematical principles, concepts, techniques and technology efficiently to solve practical and abstract problems across a range of areas in analysis and functional analysis.
demonstrate an understanding of the breadth of mathematics, the multi-disciplinary role of mathematics and the way it contributes the development in other related fields of study.
construct sustained logical, clearly presented and justified mathematical arguments incorporating deductive reasoning.
formulate and model practical and abstract problems in mathematical terms using a variety of methods drawn from analysis and functional analysis.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Revision of lecture material, doing practice problems

enrolment_rules.description: ((MATH2010 or MATH235) and (MATH2020 or MATH236)) or MATH3901 or MATH3902 or MATH3905 or MATH3906 or MATH331 or MATH332 or MATH335 or MATH336

assessments.description: The assignment will include a set of questions with short answers involving proofs and calculations.
The test will cover both the real and functional analysis components of the unit.

The final exam will cover all topics of the unit

Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit is concerned with a review of the limiting processes of real analysis and an introduction to functional analysis. Through the discussion of such abstract notions as metric spaces, normed vector spaces and inner product spaces, we can appreciate an elegant and powerful combination of ideas from analysis and linear algebra.
data.title: Real and Functional Analysis

description: This unit is concerned with a review of the limiting processes of real analysis and an introduction to functional analysis. Through the discussion of such abstract notions as metric spaces, normed vector spaces and inner product spaces, we can appreciate an elegant and powerful combination of ideas from analysis and linear algebra.
title: Real and Functional Analysis
